text.section: This section applies only in Howard County.

section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Place of public entertainment" means a business establishment that:
Does not have a license to sell alcoholic beverages but to which patrons bring alcoholic beverages the patrons have purchased elsewhere; and
Allows on its premises any activity prohibited under § 10-405 of this article.

text.section:
Any person who dispenses or serves food, beverages, or setups in a place of public entertainment or any person who is responsible for the supervision or management of a place of public entertainment shall:
Receive alcohol awareness training as specified by § 13-101 of this article; and
Refuse to facilitate in any way the continued consumption of alcoholic beverages by any patron who appears to be inebriated.

The hours and days during which a place of public entertainment may be open for business are:
Except as provided in item (2) of this subsection, 6 days per week Monday through Saturday; and
From 11:30 a.m. each day until 1:30 a.m. the next day.

section.section: A person who violates a provision of this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $5,000 for each violation.
Each day of operation in violation of this section is a separate offense.
